en: Airlines ramp up infection preventive measuresAirlines ramp up infection preventive measures Japanese airlines are ramping up measures to prevent coronavirus infections as they resume flights that were sharply reduced during the state of emergency. All Nippon Airways is requiring passengers to wear masks at the airport and on planes from Monday. It plans to increase the number of domestic flights in June by 15 percent  ... passengers to wear masks. A maximum of 20 people will be allowed to board a plane at one time. Markers at boarding gates remind passengers to practice social distancing. Operators of express buses are also gradually resuming services following the lifting of the state of emergency. A Tokyo-based bus company has resumed services on seven routes. The vehicles have ventilation equipment that ...
